node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Christina Costa in SEA LIFE Aquarium. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'CHEMOTHERAPY ROUND SJX'.

node.text:
🤍 Chemo Round 6️⃣

Continuing the tradition of going somewhere to celebrate each round and this time we chose the aquarium 🐠 

🎵 OHHHH WE’RE HALF WAY THERE 🎸 

I am starting my sixth round of chemo tonight. I have 12 total so this is the half way point and I couldn’t be happier about that. Prepping for a week of sleeping, relaxing, and watching Lost.

[image description in the alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Extreme makeover syllabus edition

node.text:
⚒ extreme makeover: syllabus edition 📄

Last year, I hosted six days to making your syllabus more inclusive and accessible. This year, I am reposting these graphics as a reminder to update your syllabus. I am missing days 5 and 6 on this post, but they are all listed in a blog post on my website www.christinacosta.net 

Something I am also doing this year is challenging myself to make my syllabus as short as it can possibly be (have gone through several drafts already) 

[image descriptions in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Extreme makeover syllabus edition
Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'day one extreme makeover: syllabus edition'.
Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text.
Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'day two extreme makeover: syllabus edition'.

Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Day Two Action Item: Policy Update your Technology Before (ableist, cold, and based off of what I had seen others do): Laptops and cell phones should not be used in class. There is lots of research that shows that laptops can be distracting to you and your colleagues' learning and our class discussion. I will notify you in advance if completing an activity that requires either. we will be inclusive) After (simple, collective, Regarding electronic devices (laptops, cell phones, etc.), we will draft the laptop policy together on the first day of class.'.
Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'day three extreme makeover: syllabus edition'.

Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Day Three Action Item: Get Rid of Excess Text Formatting in documents can make more accessible or create barriers a course Here are suggestions (from the University of Michigan linked in stories) to format text more accessibly Use the headings function to create different sections for easy access (beyond just manually changing the text) Change heavy text into a table whenever possible Create bulleted lists whenever possible'.
Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text.

Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Day Four Action Item: Check your Document for Access Accessibility to check Did you know that Microsoft Word has an accessibility checker? Use this tool your documents .check if images have captions and alt text there are links to videos, do those have If captions? Are links described instead of the URL being copy pasted?'.

Photo by Christina Costa on August 07, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Use the Accessibility Checker On the ribbon, select one of the following options, depending on which app you are using: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, select Review> Check Accessibility. Insert Design Layout References Smart Mailings Developer Comment OneNote, select View Insert Check Accessibility. Immersive Width In Authors Translate while writing or replying to an email message, select Options Message Options HTML Check Accessibility Format Text BCC Zoom ABC Permissions Security Spelling Language Grammar Check Accessibility'.
Woman sitting on the edge of a pool with palm trees in the back wearing a leopard bikini

node.text:
☀️ team teachers wear bikinis 👙 

Instagram removed my other bikini pic and I have a lot of thoughts on that which will be saved for another day

I’m convinced my last MRI was stable because of the amount of mangoes and pineapples I ate in the sun and you can’t change my mind 😘🧠

[image description in the alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Two mirror selfie’s in a hospital gown one says august 2 2020 and the other says august 2 2021

node.text:
⭐️ MRI #10 🧠 

In hindsight, it was pretty cruel to get an MRI on the same machine and the exact same day that I got my first even MRI but we survived

You know what was unstable? my emotions.  You know what was stable?  My MRI 🥰😘🧠🥺 I have tears in my eyes writing that MRI #10 was another stable one. No new tumor growth. Time to celebrate and live life. 

Coming up: chemo round 6 is coming soon after some more labs, Adriano and I are going to try to get up north to be in nature for a week, and I am brainstorming (hah) what my new tradition is going to be every time I get a stable scan - suggestions welcome 

[image description in the alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Woman sitting in a hospital bed with a hospital gown and bracelet on

node.text:
⭐️ August 2nd, 2020 ⭐️ 

Exactly one year ago, my life changed

One year ago, I laid down for an hour in a loud machine

One year ago, I went to bed at 10 pm and woke up to a call from the hospital

One year ago, I listened to the voicemail that asked me to come to the ER because of a large mass in the right hemisphere of my brain

One year ago, they showed me the image on the screen and I asked my family if they were sure they wanted to see it because it was really scary

One year ago, the nurse asked me if I had a will

One year ago, alone in the ER, I called my family and friends and loved ones and cried all night on the phone with the people I love the most

One year ago, a doctor told me they were going to give me the best quality of life for as long as they could

One year ago, I met the strongest version of me I’d ever know 🤍🤍🤍

[image description in the caption]

Service dog Lake Michigan mackinac island

node.text:
⭐️ friendly reminder, not all disabilities are visible 😘🧠⁣
⁣
when we got on the boat, a woman behind me said “oh is that a service dog?” I said yes and she replied (to me assuming I was training him for someone else) “oh my goodness thank you so much that’s such important work” 🤣 I wasn’t fast even to come up with a witty response but it stuck with me as a reminder that we never know someone’s story by looking at them 😘🧠 #butyoudontlooksick

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Christina Costa on July 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says '團 團 BOOKS FOR BRAINS NEURODIVERGENT BOOK CLUB MONTH: AUGUST HOSTED ONLINE 團围團團 ç'.

node.text:
📖 neurodivergent book club 🧠 ⁣
⁣
for all of those that want to celebrate and learn more from neurodivergent authors ⁣
⁣
I am taking medical leave this year and have been brainstorming (get it) ways to create community and do what I love most (read)⁣
⁣
This monthly book club will focus on celebrating and learning from neurodivergent authors. I have a list of books I’d love to start with and when you fill out the interest form you can vote for what you’d like to read first. ⁣
⁣
I will be creating a guide for each book and there will be a couple of different options to virtually discuss at the end of each month. You can participate as much or as little as you’d like!⁣
⁣
Hope you are ready to learn with me this year 🤍🧠📖 go to my stories or link below to sign up via the interest form⁣
⁣
You do not have to be a teacher or work in education to join us 🤍⁣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Christina Costa on July 11, 2021. May be an image of text that says '團 團 BOOKS FOR BRAINS NEURODIVERGENT BOOK CLUB MONTH: AUGUST HOSTED ONLINE 團围團團 ç'.

Photo by Christina Costa on July 11, 2021. May be an image of ‎text that says '‎We will be ۔gn up using reading and learning from a variety of neurodivergent authors the google form in my stories or the link in my profile Vote for the August book‎'‎.
Girl In front of fountain with board that says chemotherapy round 5

node.text:
😘🧠 Chemotherapy Round 5️⃣ 🤍⁣
⁣
Continuing the tradition of going somewhere beautiful before each round of chemo 🤍 yesterday Adriano, Neuro, and I visited Belle Isle and got ice cream afterwards, and I started chemo last night ⁣
⁣
Things are ok. My body is tolerating the chemo relatively well and my biggest symptom is just being very tired the week of chemo and after. My next scan will be in four weeks, and as always, hoping that that scan stable⁣
⁣
Thanks for being here 🤍🤍🤍⁣
⁣
Id: picture is of me holding a sign that says chemotherapy round 5 (letter board) I’m sitting on the edge of a large concrete fountain on Belle Isle in Detroit
